abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Social Policy and
            Community Services Project for Lithuania was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was highly likely, the institutional
            development impact was substantial, and the Bank and
            borrower performance were both satisfactory. Following are
            lessons learned from the project: Comprehensive and
            participatory project preparation that includes substantial
            analytical work, initial development of policy framework and
            basic principles of institutional and organizational
            framework is critical to ensure high quality implementation.
            Although the project was clear about expected outcomes, the
            key performance indicators were not very useful to monitor
            project performance. Flexibility to adjust the lending
            instrument (for example, formal gradual closure of fully
            implemented project components) that would take into account
            the changed circumstances would benefit the project. For
            project activities where cooperation between different
            levels of government is essential, more efforts need to be
            spent initially to build real partnership that is based on
            mutual understanding about the objectives and benefits of
            the joint program. Capacity building for policy analysis,
            monitoring and evaluation takes time.
